cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SW of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west into the SE Gulf, then forecast to turn NW and finally NE across Florida and up the U.S. East Coast toward the Carolinas/Mid-Atlantic

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina and the Mid-Atlantic coast including Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Potential for tropical-storm-force gusts (35–40 mph) late Friday into early Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge (generally <3 ft) possible along the lower Chesapeake Bay if the center passes just offshore
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could bring 2–4 inches with locally higher totals
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and hazardous marine conditions that could disrupt port traffic and anchorage
